newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on Friday on retail and interbank interest, dealers said.

"The interbank rate rose slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were narrowly mixed but bond prices were slightly lower. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.93/2.88 percent compared with Thursday's yield of 2.90/2.85 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.80/2.75 percent against 2.82/2.77 percent.
Among bonds, April 1999 ended at S$98.30/98.35 from Thursday's close of S$98.32/98.37, May 2002 at S$99.33/99.38 versus S$99.38/99.48 and June 2003 at S$94.33/94.38 against S$94.40/94.45.
The overnight interbank offered rate rose to 3 2-7/8 percent from Thursday's 2-1/2 2-3/8 percent.
